comments.body: I like the idea, but why hay? Something like bonemeal should work.

I think this is a great idea! Maybe it would even turn green like the normal copper blocks that will be added soon. However, to make it seem less overpowered, it might make you more likely to be struck by lightning when holding it.
I don't think no enchantments. I still think unbreaking and trident specific enchants. Maybe not mending though

this would also allow the Sculk plant (current Sculk Sensor) to be used as decoration without having to worry about the redstone signal triggering anything by accident.

great idea
Or potentially gold nuggets, iron nuggets, or emeralds (in mountain biomes)
A saw another feedback that also suggested making more arrows out of other materials and that changing the properties of the arrow, which adding a feature like this would be pretty epic as well.
Don't build such farms then.
You could add more weapons such as battle axes that would do more damage but be slower. Katanas which would be faster and harder to make. And other various Middle Ages weapons.

I like the idea of adding new foods into minecraft like combining bread cheese and pork to make a pizza or fish and potato to make fish and chips.

I think that if new foods are added there needs to be a reason to eat them.
Each food should have a unique eat time, saturation and hunger level as they do now. But there needs to be another reason to eat different foods.
In some mods eating varied foods gives you additional hearts which is a good idea but the game is balanced around having 10 hearts.
Maybe eating varied foods makes you fitter meaning you loose saturation more slowly from sprinting and running.

Nice, but I think there should be a cheese block that comes from placing a bucket of milk in the milk churner. The cheese block should then be crafted into cheese slices. Nine cheese slices can make a cheese block, like with diamond and gold.
I really love this idea! I think butter should be crafted to with bread to make toast with butter. This could make another new achievement called 'nice and toasty' or something like that.

I would like to see this done! Originally, I was going to post a suggestion for soundproof glass, but that might be too modern. I like your idea of a block that is made of material similar to earplugs. I think that's foam and/or rubber. It seems less like it's man-made compared to soundproof glass.
I would like this so I can mute redstone contraptions, maybe by surrounding an area with the soundproof block. What you've posted is over a year old, but I hope developers will revisit and reconsider this idea of yours.
It would be great for making sneaky tnt traps because no one will be able to notice. Mwahahahahah!

Making wool a block that muffles/cancels sound is a great idea! Especially because the upcoming update (1.17) has a feature in which wool can be used to block a skulk sensor from recieving vibrations. It would make sense to add this feature.

I feel like "aesthetically", this could be a rather easy adaptation of the current carpet block. Basically flip carpet on it's edge so it may be applied to walls. Then incorporate/adapt the current mechanic that "turning away" from sound sources utilizes.

Blocking animal noises would be great too. Sometimes you want all your pets/animals around your house but would rather not hear the constant barking/meowing/mooing/neighing/slime hopping all the time when you're inside your minecraft home
Please make wool provide soundproofing, it would be pretty intuitive.

Yeah, sorry, but Mojang is not going to completely overhaul the tool system just because you didn't find a second diamond ore. Also, something like this would get so complicated that it's just not worth it. How would a pair of leather leggings edged with diamonds work, for example? Or a stone axe edged with a gold ingot? There's more than just durability and attack damage to take into account here.

Would diamond edged diamond armour exist with this?

Sounds like a great idea though, what with the combat update coming soon

In Concept: Cool idea.

In Execution: Pretty Bad idea.

Minecraft, as a game, is supposed to be about simple-to-learn game mechanics. That's why the crafting system worked so well. You don't have to know all the recipes. There's the obvious stuff, like planks, workbenches, and tools, but when you bring in a mechanic that functionally destroys tools and armour, it gets rid of the simplicity of Minecraft. Not to mention the absolute mess it would bring to the durability system.

I thought it was there. Guess I must have misclicked.

Thanks. : )

I'm not sure.  The 2x2 dark oak has such a small canopy, I almost can't imagine a single sapling dark oak tree.

The other issue is the fact that the single oak sapling will never grow can be useful for people who want to do landscaping.

I do agree that the swamp would be improved with something other than modified oak trees.  However, I think the better solution is to add more unique trees with wood types that we don't have yet.  (I have two options suggested here)
I think leaving the Dark Oak as a 2x2 only mechanic would fit it better.  What the swamp needs is its own tree, the Mangrove! :)
How about an alternative cream y light colored wood like cypress or a red wood like mahogany in swamps.

The mangrove sounds really good  I'm not sure about creamy bright woods though. I think that would kind of detract from the swamps being a dark dreary sort of place.

Come to think of it thought a mud block for swamps would be cool. Basically functions as soul sand, or alternatively just have soul sand in the swamps.
Add dead trees to the swamp and dead or discoloured lily pads.

I think you're thinking of horseshoes.  Horses are born with hooves.

What would the enchantments be?  Do the horseshoes have durability, or are they like horse armor and saddles?
Yep. Horseshoes. My mistake.
Horseshoes should be enchatntable for better benefits, like the frost walker maybe?
Frost walker and unbreaking would be god tier!
Horseshoes with feather falling!! Too many steeds fallen to their deaths! TnT
The blacksmith should sell them.

This seems way too tricky to implement for something that would almost assuredly look terrible. Banners are really detailed - how do you expect them to look even recognizable if stuck onto your left boot??
i would think you are smart enough to know that you need a specal design for boots
Thanks for the compliment. Would you mind explaining a little better what you mean by a "specal design"?

This is a cool idea, but I must give MacchuPicchu96 right. It would be quite difficult to implement.

Also, if you want your armor to look better, use or make a resource pack.
I think this would only work on the cheastpice but cool idea for that!
Yes even if only on chestplates this would be great for sports jerseys

I was just running around in creative mode and was making a castle. I made an armory room and then made a flag. But then I thought of a cool idea to put banner designs on armored just like in medieval times The banner design will go on to the chesplate An make a cool design
Not just leather. Iron, Diamond, Chain etc

You know, on one hand, this entire posts strikes me as completely unnecessary. I am quite used to the way ores and stones generate in Minecraft and I have no problem with it.

And yet, no the other hand, I really like your ideas for some reason. Allow me to first say that your writing is excellent and I appreciate the way you tried to address all possible impacts of your ideas rather than just tossing out two sentences without a thought as to their ramifications upon the rest of the game. Second, you seem to be bothered by the fact that unless you are specifically seeking them out for building, stone variants are useless from a mining perspective. This desire to want most everything in Minecraft to have its purpose is what has driven me to share quite a few ideas myself on this site. Shameless plug: check them out. I think you might like them.

Now to actually address your ideas: you've somehow convinced me that this wacky idea could actually work. I don't want to comment on textures until we see JAPPA's final product, and I don't really care about your idea's effects on modded play. But I have to say, your proposition to have ore veins span across more than one stone variant is particularly tantalizing to me from an aesthetics point of view. At the end of the day you're proposing a relatively simple change that would look great and not break the game's balance. This is the kind of well thought-out idea that should be getting lots of attention here on this site. You have more than earned my vote!
This is kinda like what one of my ideas said except I said that I wanted to see new ores like copper and tin

I would really love to see the ores within blocks, as to me, this is considered an 'inconsistency,' which mind you, I really hope will be patched in the 1.15 update, which is supposed to be fixing all of these inconsistencies. 

As for the crafting, I don't agree as much with you, but that is only because they only allow for cobblestone to be used in crafting stone tools. 

If they were to add it, I would question whether or not mining the three stone varieties should drop a 'rough' version, as with cobblestone, again, to ease consistency issues. I believe the current textures should become the 'rough' ones, as they do not look all too smooth as for currently. Another 'smooth' texture should be added, which would be used to create polished blocks, similarly to stone and stone bricks. 

Something you didn't mention in the post, however, is specific stones for each biome. I believe this would have to happen in a major cave update, which has been highly requested. Some things proposed for that are ice caves, which would also completely change the vibe of caves in general, which would help this to blend in. But like I said, this would probably be in with a major cave update as randomly doing this would jar a lot of players.

I would also recommend putting the 'to summarize' bit at the top as to not deter any readers with a wall of text.

I really want this suggestion to happen.

I would also like to add that diorite and granite are typically formed in mountainous regions. Andesite is formed on the surface in volcanic regions. The same for obsidian (which is apparently a type of glass), but only when it cools much quicker, and should probably spawn around surface lava pools, alongside andesite. These are all igneous rocks, diorite and granite being intrusive, andesite and obsidian being extrusive.

The only sedimentary rock would be sandstone, which should probably also spawn in the entire ocean floor as well as cave and surface pools. Rivers, however, would logically spawn with gravel.

Metamorphosis rocks are the two previous, combined via heat and pressure. Naturally, these would spawn at lower y values. I'm not aware of any of this type in the game as of now.

Feel free to correct me.
interesting
I like the idea, but why "Oracle"?

Yeah it's so annoying when I have my axe out and I accidentally hit a piece of wood I want as normal wood or the same thing with shovels 

It's way too easy to accidentally do it
it will be like : NOICE

I had the same idea, but i also want the nether to have air hot enough to burn you. If gold armor could protect you from this, it would become crucial for game progress

Maybe you'd can dye it, make it glow, could come from a strange mob perhaps?

I am a bedrock only player and this would be awesome!!!!!!!
😆😆😆😆😆😆😆😆😆😎😎😎😈

How do you get world edit: When I type //wand it still would not give me it
we need built in to all versions but bedrock aspecially
Broo I always get jealous that YouTubers are always using world edit when we have to work hard for space

Craft some enchanting books and a totem of undying and you will get a spellbook of a quality depending on the rarity of the enchantments. (I, II, III, IV, V, VI, VII, or X) You can hold the book in your off-hand, then use a wand or stalf to cast spells like the evoker or illusioner. Afterwards, villagers will be scared of you, and witches will be neutral.
I dont think it would fit Minecraft
We got ladders we don’t need ropes
Not sure if ropes are necessary, but seems like the Weeping Vines should be a good point to start.

they would be like when chains were vertical only, except you can climb them. They would be placable like lanterns, but when placed on the ground (rather than the roof) they would coil up into an unclimbable version.
Yes! This will make smithing tables actually have a use in the overworld.
This sounds interesting, but how would you balance the fact that you now only need one diamond for a diamond pick?
This sounds a bit overpowered in my opinion... People would just go make stone tools then upgrade them for way cheaper than the usual price.

I really wish there was a reply function on here. 

After chatting with a few friends about this idea, I'm thinking that maybe the smithing table should require the same number of resources as crafting the respective tool. For instance: a stone pickaxe requires 3 stone, so to upgrade it to an iron pick, you need to obtain 3 iron ingots to upgrade it to an iron pick. If you want to upgrade an iron sword to a gold sword, you would need two gold ingots in the smithing table to upgrade it. The one exception would be Diamond to Netherite due to how rare netherite is. With this change in mind, I think it would be best if the smithing table requires experience levels to upgrade if and only if the tool has enchantments on it.
yes that looks like a good one. I also really need it.

I think this is a great idea, but I do agree with the concerns over balancing the amount of resource used in upgrading.

I think the simplest solution that would keep the smithing table functioning mostly the same is to make all upgrades besides netherite require an entire block of the upgrade material.

Stone to iron needs an iron block, gold to diamond needs a diamond block, but diamond to netherite would still only need an ingot.

This will make smithing tables purely a tool for moving good enchantments to a higher material tier (maybe making enchanted iron loot actually useful).

I think the Ravager should be tamed first and then maybe the player could use the Ravager's saddle to rid him. One thing that could happen was that the Ravager would attack the player after the player riding him for too long. Overall, is a great idea!
Ravager armor anyone?
Riding a Ravager should be a lot harder. For example, it can have a chance to randomly throw the player off and start attacking them.

Cool concept. But, If you didn't Already know Minecraft has a deep lore maily centering around the villagers/ illagers/ pillagers. This probably won't happen since ravagers may be villagers transformed by  the illagers into a monster. So because villagers themselves don't arready drop anything. It would make sense for ravagers to be the same.

Well, Ravagers themselves are rare and also hard to kill.  I could make it so that they don't always drop them, and instead just a regular saddle.  And I agree for the idea they should be tamed first.  Any ideas on how they should be tamed?  I also suppose the idea of being attacked for riding it too long is great.  Maybe if you ride it for twenty minutes straight and a twenty minute cooldown.  They would attack once (but not kill you since they're tamed) to let you know you've been on for too long.

Maybe the saddle itself should have maybe a 75% chance of dropping (I would lower the chance if the Ravager was more common).

TheKiwiMango5 Well first off that isn't confirmed. Just because GameTheory makes a theory, doesn't mean it is automatically true and that is canon. It is only a guess what may be true. Who know's, maybe it could mean nothing at all. So it isn't really fair to say something should do something because of a theory MatPat had. All though it seems tight and makes sense, in the end it is just a theory. A GAME THEORY (sorry lmao) Plus look how many times he has re-written the fnaf story line. I'm not saying you can't or shouldn't believe it, I am saying you should be aware that it isn't confirmed or 100% true. 
 
But in relation to this I agree with Kiwi it should only drop a saddle, due to being able to ride a Ravager is way to powerful. Besides, the totem of undying and the emeralds you get is enough of an award.
I'm pretty sure Ravagers aren't meant to be ridden. Plus, that would be too OP if you consider the Ravagers stats compared to a horse.
nah

I recommend the same saddle could be used to tame Hoglins.

But how would you tame a ravager? Would you find them in the wild? Steal them from the Pillagers?

agreeing with the dork1muffin once again at the end of every video matpat legit says its just a theory a game theory also controlling ravagers would be too op raids would be easy you could just walk over pillagers anyways that's how I feel

Well you could tame it with cake or sweet foods and the saddle could fit two players though it would be slow also it would be dangerous to go near as it could attack you so you have to sneak up on it and to make it fair it could die after say 50 in game days anyone like that.? Also that’s just a suggestion a game suggestion annd cut
The crafting recipe should be this: same as normal hopper, but replace the iron ingots with netherite scraps. This would yield maybe 8-16 hoppers.
Maybe these hoppers could interact with ender chests

I feel like it'd be more of a crafting table recipe, something like 8 hoppers surrounding a netherite ingot, similar to the lodestone. A full stack or even half a stack does seem a bit too cheap, and I think people need to put the effort into obtaining these regardless of how many are used in the actual builds, but that's just my opinion ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Really strongly agree. I think it should be 4 times fast as a regular hopper, because it takes 25 minutes to drain a large chest full of stackable items. Say you had a giant sorting machine and a large chest full of items to sort. The netherite hopper could drain it in less than a quarter the time as a regular hopper. Like other netherite, it would be immune to lava. It would have 10 slots instead of the usual 5. It could be made with a netherite ingot surrounded by hoppers and it gives you 8 netherite hoppers.

I had a similar idea but was thinking the recipe would be the same as an iron hopper. The only difference was that i was thinking a netherite hopper would be blast proof and a gold hopper would be almost as fast as a hopper minecart. Might add a leather hopper that is slower but when water logged would have expanded capacity. Basically all the armor types would have a hopper with a different effect. not sure on Diamond though.
Yeah. Crafting tools and armor needs to have more reward and be more fleshed out. The smithing table could fix that!
Definitely a good idea, I would love to have more sub armor
I think the upgrading part might be a bit op as is. If after upgrading thevtool to the next tier, it starts at around 25% durability, then that might help.
This would make chainmail more useful as well! I was about to write this myself, so +1

I think it'd be nice to add improvements like +1, etc. This would make it so I could have a +1 diamond plate. This is what I was hoping for when I saw the UI in the latest snapshot. This would add a huge depth and value, and many variations. Just because I don't have access to diamonds yet, but I have a smithing table, I'd love to upgrade my iron mail to a +1 or +2 etc.

To go even FURTHER, you could allow us to add manual elemental enchantments (wouldn't go against putting books on with an anvil, as it'd only do elemental). But wouldn't an ice sword +2 sound awesome to freeze a zombie in place? Combine ice cube block with ancient debris and you get 'ice dust' or something, which you could apply to a sword to upgrade it. Now some more depth, combine it to an armor and now you have cold resistance (in case PVP, or an enemy were to attack with cold).
I would love to see more smithing upgrades to diamonds and not just netherite.
